newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian MPs to take no further action on Di Rupo.
newsitem.headline: Belgian MPs to take no further action on Di Rupo.

text.p: A Belgian parliamentary commission voted on Thursday by seven to four to take no further action on allegations that Deputy Prime Minister Elio Di Rupo had sex with under-age boys, a commission member said.

The vote, pitting representatives of the country's governing centre-left coalition against the opposition, came after three days and nights of often bitter arguments among the 11-member commission. The vote must be endorsed by the full parliament.
"There is no reason to indict Di Rupo...There is no indication of guilt," Francophone Socialist Jean-Paul Henri told reporters.

But the commission approved a draft law short-circuiting cumbersome parliamentary procedures and allowing the Cour de Cassation, Belgium's highest court, to investigate allegations against government ministers without having to consult parliament first.

"It is very positive that we now have a law that allows the Cour de Cassation to investigate allegations against ministers without the intervention of parliament," said Flemish Christian Democrat Tony Van Parys.
However, some representatives of the opposition immediately accused the ruling coalition of mounting a cover-up in the affair that has scandalised the nation.
